text: Prince Henry, Duke of Gloucester, (Henry William Frederick Albert; 31 March 1900 â€“ 10 June 1974) was an English royal and politician. He was the third son and fourth child of King George V and Queen Mary. He was Governor-General of Australia from 1945 to 1947, the only member of the British royal family to hold the post.Australian Dictionary of Biography Prince Henry died on 10 June 1974 from problems caused by multiple strokes at Barnwell Manor in Northamptonshire at the age of 74. ==References== Category:1900 births Category:1974 deaths Category:British princes Category:Governors-general of Australia Category:Politicians from London Category:Royalty from London
title: Prince Henry, Duke of Gloucester
